Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain
Comments_List: Learning about the various methods implicated in different areas of the field.
A more comprehensive understanding of the stem cell field.
A broad understanding of concepts relation to various types of adult stem cells, as well as applications of stem cell biology.

This class introduced many different concepts in stem cell biology and gave me a solid background in the field.  I not only learned about stem cell biology, but I also was introduced to how stem cells can be used in medicine in addition to the ethical considerations of this.
I developed my soft research skills. Specifically, my skills in reading and writing in time-efficient ways, and in my consciousness of contemporary biological research techniques and applications.

We read literature to learn about current findings regarding the different types of stem cells. There were different professors for almost every lecture who spoke on stem cells related to their research (e.g. retinal, embryonic, neural,etc.).
Integrating the past, present, and future of stem cell biology research.

I learnt a lot about differentiation and learnt that the concept of stem cells is more complicated and nuance than it is often made out to be. I also learnt presentation skills and how to summarise papers well.
Have no idea how we are doing in class because of the way assignments are structured.

Very good course for surveying the entire stem cell field. It could be difficult at times for every instructor to teach scheduled class due to conflicts- may need to plan ahead for potential conflicts (retreats, etc)
Schedule was not consistent (several classes reschedule for other times where not every student could make it).

I thought every professor who taught this course gave an excellent lecture.  I really liked the emphasis on the recent developments and techniques used in the field.  I also thought the format of the class was well done, with the first half of class being lecture-based and the second half of class being presentation-based.

I think the course was great! I think it would be helpful to receive some specific feedback over the course so I know how well I'm doing. I think that would be helpful given the particular soft skills refined by this course. In particular, feedback on the presentation would be helpful. All of the students have given presentations before. If there is not some more specific feedback for these students, then these presentations become mere pieces of busy work. Speaking experience is good, but without topic specific feedback, it wouldn't actually matter what the students are presenting. In my opinion, without that topic specific feedback, students could get a similar advantage from presenting their favorite foods and movies. I guess the presentation does force students to go study and contemplate a topic in depth. But this focus is only on one topic, which may or may not be related to specific student interests or research goals.

There is never any feedback returned to the students. I received two comments out of all the weekly assignments turned in. However I received no grades on the weekly literature summaries and no grade on the final paper.
Felt repetitive because each lecture was a guest lecturer, so there wasn't continuity. Hard to fix without completely revamping the course design though.
Course structure could be better organized and we could have got more feedback
Yes.
Yes. Very useful course to gain knowledge of the field
Yes. The organizers do a great jib of selecting a variety of lecturers who are experts in many different parts of the stem cell biology field.
Yes, it was very interesting and well organized.
I would recommend this class. This class is engaging and offers a great opportunity to improve soft research skills in the context of an interesting topic.

Yes, even though the course wasnt exactly as I expected and there were no grades returned I still learned a lot. I think this is a good course for those who work with stem cells or are interested in learning more about them.
I think if you are interested in the topic, go for it. It's low workload and it's fun to meet many different faculty.
The topics taught in the course are interesting, so if you want to learn about stem cells take it. but you will get no feedback whatsoever in the entire course.
